intro: Castilleja minor, commonly known as the small milkvetch, is a hemiparasitic plant native to North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright orange to red flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges. Its roots form symbiotic relationships with other plants, drawing nutrients from them. Castilleja minor plays a role in maintaining ecological balance by influencing plant community dynamics.
